channel.title: How to make commands work on client
channel.description: Im just wondering how you would get it like if i wanted to get a command like ::stuck to work if I press F6 it'll automatically type that in.. Please any help is appreciated!

item.title: How to make commands work on client
item.dc:creator: @RSCLives RSCLives
item.description:
@RSCLives wrote:

I never gave up and it works! Now you can check it out at the Show-off in the Development section!

Read full topic

item.title: How to make commands work on client
item.dc:creator: @GothKing5000 GothKing5000
item.description:
@GothKing5000 wrote:

[quote=“Kryptix, post:1, topic:358754”][quote author=GothKing5000 link=topic=455223.msg3333360#msg3333360 date=1283669535]

Im just wondering how you would get it like if i wanted to get a command like ::stuck to work if I press F6 it’ll automatically type that in… Please any help is appreciated!

open the server source… copy the command stuck… open client source… add key F6 into the keys case…
paste the copied command from server source… close and save all… recompile all… restart all… enjoy.
[/quote]
Please tell me you’re joking…[/quote]

lmfao… yea… i kid i kid…
gotta poke some fun…

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Read full topic
item.source: How to make commands work on client

item.title: How to make commands work on client
item.dc:creator: @GothKing5000 GothKing5000
item.description:
@GothKing5000 wrote:

RSCLives:

Im just wondering how you would get it like if i wanted to get a command like ::stuck to work if I press F6 it’ll automatically type that in… Please any help is appreciated!

open client source…
open mudclient…
find or add key F6 into the keys case…
add command to generate packet for stuck command… (most complicated part to figure out… lol)
close and save all… recompile all… restart all…
enjoy.

Read full topic
